title: Add a glossary / naming conventions standard
body:
## Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.
Would be good to standardize conventions for certain parameters/descriptions during our effort to improve the API.

For example, for all the graspy embeddings, we called the dimensionality of the embedding `n_components` to match sklearn
Node2vec calls this `dimensions`

For most of the parallelization that used joblib, we called the number of workers `n_jobs` to match joblib
But in some places, in graspy/graspologic/topologic, it's `workers`

## Describe the solution you'd like
I think consistency with parameter names as well as explaining some of the common terms we might take for granted would be good. 

I really really like how sklearn has [this glossary](https://scikit-learn.org/stable/glossary.html) to both explain terms but also define standards, I think we could do something similar.

## Additional context
This will probably be ongoing work, but we could start a document where we at least define/discuss the standard terms
and variable names we want to shoot for. 

Will also make it easier for new people to contribute I'd think.
